text: I know that I'm getting the real deal with my mom. I know that she's telling it like it is. She's proud of me when I've earned it and she's disappointed in me when I've earn that. She's really my spectrum on where I am as a person.
author: Lara Flynn Boyle

text: I had such a great mom and I know that I'd never be that mom. I wouldn't want to bring a child into this world unless I could be.
author: Lara Flynn Boyle

text: My mom calls me an older soul because, growing up, she taught me stuff real early. Now I spend most of my time chasing wisdom, chasing understanding.
author: Ray Lewis

text: Mom thinks I live in this dream world where everybody's Ivana Trump.
author: Kathie Lee Gifford

text: Over the years my mom has become a self-taught Biblical scholar.
author: Kathie Lee Gifford
